MSFT &#160; NASDAQ Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter). Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item&#8201;5.02. Departure of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers On January&#160;22, 2025, Christopher D. Young informed Microsoft Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) of his decision to resign from the Company. As a result, he will cease to serve as Executive Vice President, Business Development, Strategy, and Ventures, effective immediately. He will remain an employee of the Company to provide transition support and fulfill additional responsibilities until the end of March. SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &#160; &#160; MICROSOFT CORPORATION Date: January&#160;22, 2025 &#160; / S / K EITH R. D OLLIVER &#160; Keith R. Dolliver &#160; Corporate Secretary
